import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

#Ignore warnings
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.86738528: df = df.rename(columns={'Hostel Name':'name', 'DESTINATION': 'destination',  'Price (starting)': 'price',  'Free Breakfast': 'breakfast',  'Wifi': 'wifi',  'Rating (out of 10)': 'rate',   'Total Ratings': 'ratings'})
source.818a5ef0:
#word cloud
from wordcloud import WordCloud, ImageColorGenerator
text = " ".join(str(each) for each in df.destination)
# Create and generate a word cloud image:
wordcloud = WordCloud(max_words=200,colormap='Pastel1', background_color="black").generate(text)
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
# Display the generated image:
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='Bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.figure(1,figsize=(12, 12))
plt.show()
source.5a36347b:
#Code by Siti K https://www.kaggle.com/khotijahs1/2020-indonesia-university-rank/comments

#The Best 20 Hostels by Total Ratings
top_dest = df.sort_values(by='ratings', ascending=False)[:20]
figure = plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
sns.barplot(y=top_dest.name, x=top_dest.ratings)
plt.xticks()
plt.xlabel('Ratings')
plt.ylabel('Hostel Name')
plt.title('Top 20 Hostels by Ratings')
plt.show()
source.dbe2a09c:
# categorical features with missing values
categorical_nan = [feature for feature in df.columns if df[feature].isna().sum()>0 and df[feature].dtypes=='O']
print(categorical_nan)
source.8c3121c0:
#Remove dots to avoid errors ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10

#Code by Sohom Majumder https://www.kaggle.com/sohommajumder21/statistical-tests-for-understanding-life-value/comments

df['rate']=df['rate'].str.replace('.', '')
df['rate'] = pd.to_numeric(df['rate'], errors = 'coerce')

figure = plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
sns.barplot(y=top_dest.name, x=top_dest.rate)
plt.xticks()
plt.xlabel('Ratings out of 10')
plt.ylabel('Hostel Name')
plt.title('Top 20 Hostels by Rating (out of 10)')
plt.show()
